edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.model

Class Park

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.model.Park
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Park>

    public class Park
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Comparable<Park>
    A Park in the GetOutdoors system represents a collection of trails for a single park in the system. This is modelled by having each TrailList maintain the Park at which the Trails are located. Each Park also maintains the change in snow depth, in inches, from the most recent snowfall of melt. Park is an Observable type, and notifies its observers on construction and when a new snowfall or melt is recorded via setSnowChange().
    Author:
    demills

    • Constructor Detail

      • Park

        public Park(java.lang.String parkID,
            java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String description)
        Constructs a Park with the passed id, name, and description. The parameters must not be null, empty, or contain only whitespace. Construction is delegated to the Park(String,String,String,double) constructor. Any leading or trailing whitespace is trimmed from valid Strings. Observers are notified of the change at the end of construction.
        Parameters:
        parkID - the park's ID.
        name - the park's name.
        description - a brief description of the park.

      • Park

        public Park(java.lang.String parkID,
            java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String description,
            double snowChange)
        Constructs a Park with the passed id, name, description, and snowfall delta. The parameters must not be null, empty, or contain whitespace. Construction is delegated to the Park(String,String,String,double) constructor. Any leading or trailing whitespace is trimmed from valid Strings. Observers of Park are notified at the end of construction.
        Parameters:
        parkID - the park's ID.
        name - the park's name.
        description - a brief description of the park.
        snowChange - the value, in inches, of the most recent snowfall or melt.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the String parameters are null, empty, or contain whitespace.

      • getSnowChange

        public double getSnowChange()
        Returns the value of the most recent snowfall or melt in inches. A negative value indicates that snow has melted and a positive value indicates that snow has fallen.
        Returns:
        the most recent change in snow depth, in inches.

      • setSnowChange

        public void setSnowChange(double snowChange)
        Sets the value of the most recent snowfall or melt in inches. A negative value should be passed if snow has melted and a positive value if snow has fallen.
        Parameters:
        snowChange - the number of inches of snow that have fallen or melted.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Park otherPark)
        Compares this Park to another based on names. The actual comparison is delegated to String.compareTo(). A negative value indicates that this Park precedes the passed Park in the natural Park ordering, and vice versa. A value of 0 indicates that these Park's have identical names.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Park>
        Parameters:
        otherPark - the Park to compare this Park to.
        Returns:
        returns a negative int if this Park precedes the passed Park, a positive int if this Park succeeds the passed Park, and zero if this Park occupies the same position as the passed.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the Park formatted as a tab-delimited String of the Park's name, description, and snowChange. For example, for a Park with the following fields, - name = "Pullen Park" - description = "A historic, pleasant local park." - snowChange = 0 toString() would return a String formatted as: "Pullen Park\tA historic, pleasant local park.\t0"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        returns a tab-delimited String of the Park's name, description, and snowchange.
